DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure CD4-Positive T-Lymphocytes, Regulatory Percentage Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The numeric regulatory percentage value related to CD3 CD4 in a specimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure CD4-Positive T-Lymphocyte T-Lymphocytes, Regulatory Result
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the results of the medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood for a CD4+ T-Helper lymphocyte, a type of white blood cell that helps stimulate immune system reactions and help to activate cytotoxic T cells and macrophages by secreting cytokines as well as stimulate B cells to make antibodies._CD4-positive T cells that inhibit immunopathology or autoimmune disease in vivo. They inhibit the immune response by influencing the activity of other cell types. Regulatory T-cells include naturally occurring CD4+CD25+ cells, IL-10 secreting Tr1 cells, and Th3 cells__The result of an action.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: A type of white blood cell that helps stimulate immune system reactions.  Helper T cells help activate cytotoxic T cells and macrophages by secreting cytokines. They also stimulate B cells to make antibodies.:CD4-positive T cells that inhibit immunopathology or autoimmune disease in vivo. They inhibit the immune response by influencing the activity of other cell types. Regulatory T-cells include naturally occurring CD4+CD25+ cells, IL-10 secreting Tr1 cells, and Th3 cells.:The result of an action.

Concepts.definition: A type of white blood cell that helps stimulate immune system reactions.  Helper T cells help activate cytotoxic T cells and macrophages by secreting cytokines. They also stimulate B cells to make antibodies.

CD4-positive T cells that inhibit immunopathology or autoimmune disease in vivo. They inhibit the immune response by influencing the activity of other cell types. Regulatory T-cells include naturally occurring CD4+CD25+ cells, IL-10 secreting Tr1 cells, and Th3 cells.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the value as a percentage of 100.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Percentage; a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: v1.1 of VD replaces v1.0 to increase overall field length and include 2 decimal places. 1.14.2016.dmr

DataElement.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form
